page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: { THE BLOCK:}NEARLY 10 MILES SOUTH- WEST OF BRISTOL AND TO THE NORTH OF THE MENDIP HILLS.IT IS AT THE WEST END OF BLAGDON LAKE.IT IS BOUNDED BY BURRINGTON IN THE SOUTH-WEST CORNER AND BUTCOMBE IN THE NORTH-EAST. { THE HILLS:}THE MENDIP HILLS RUN ALONG THE SOUTH OF BLOCK REACHING 122M. ABOVE SEA-LEVEL AT THE HIGHEST POINT. THE LAND IN THE NORTH-EAST CORNER REACHES A HEIGHT OF 127M. { THE LAKE:}TWO-THIRDS OF BLAGDON LAKE COVERS A SIXTH OF THE BLOCK. IT SUPPLIES WATER TO THE BRISTOL WATERWORKS COMPANY. { THE RIVER:}THE YEO RUNS NORTH-EAST FROM THE LAKE TOWARDS THE SEVERN. { ROUTES:}IN THE SOUTH THE WESTON- SUPER-MARE TO BATH ROAD HUGS THE HILLS AT ABOUT 100M.ABOVE SEA-LEVEL WHILE THE OLD EXETER TO BRISTOL COACH ROAD CUTS ACROSS THE NORTH-WEST CORNER.
